page.title: 01THE WHELMETHAMS & SURROUNDS
page.content: This is an area of outstanding natural beauty, there is very little industry apart from the sale of crops produced by the surrounding farms: there are only two other industries. The rake factory which produces the wooden rakes that used to be seen hanging on trees in oarchards to help harvest the fruit. The other industry is Overlands, a farm machinery outlet for John Deere farm machinery. There is an old railway line which has now been transformed to a nature walk which has won the first prize for the best walk two years in succession. These villages are not compact but spread over a large area due to the fact that about two hundred years ago all villages in this area were divided into two settlements - Chapel and Church of England. This district is three miles from Bury St. Edmunds with
